    Visualize a Decision Tree SVM

    visualize_svm_tree.Rd

    Generates plots of SVM decision boundaries for each node in a decision tree SVM. Optionally, it can calculate accuracy at each node and return the data used for plotting.

    visualize_svm_tree(
  tree,
  original_data,
  features,
  response_col = NULL,
  max_depth = NULL,
  check_accuracy = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    tree

    A decision tree SVM object created using `svm_split()`.

    original_data

    A data frame containing the original training data.

    features

    A character vector of feature names to be used for plotting.

    response_col

    Optional. Name of the response column. If `NULL`, it will be auto-detected.

    max_depth

    Optional. Maximum depth to visualize. If `NULL`, the entire tree is visualized.

    check_accuracy

    Logical. Whether to compute node-level accuracy for the original data.

    Value

    A list containing:

    plots

    A named list of ggplot2 objects for each node.

    grid_data

    A named list of data frames used for plotting decision boundaries.

    accuracy_info

    A named list of node-level accuracy information.

    response_col

    The name of the response column used.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# tree <- svm_split(train_data, response = "Class")
viz <- visualize_svm_tree(tree, train_data, features = c("X1", "X2"))
viz$plots$depth_1_Root
} # }
